Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially black in section, the interior is thickly caked with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is covered with a red-brown slip and bears the remains of two lines of Coptic text written in black ink, now smudged.
Curator's comments: To be published by J. Cromwell
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393282) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393282)
